reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small, but modern and very clean. The bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed with lots of clean fluffy towels. Check in staff were efficient and were able to explain the local bus service to us. The breakfast was served on the roof, in the tent that is described in previous reviews. On one of our days there was a torrential downpour and there were several leaks. It is chilly up there (taking into account that it is January) so dress approriately.. the breakfast itself is reasonable, given the price tag. The lift goes all the way to the roof, but is incorrectly labelled on the inside screen. (get off when the screen says level three when your room is on the fourth floor!) We were put off using the restaurant in the evening but thanks to another review on this website we visited some local very good and very very reasonable restaurants in the local area. (much cheaper and more authentic than the city centre where the tourist premium is high) We went to Ferro e Ghisa on the main road, Circ.ne Aurelia and Joseph's in the Via Accursio. Both of these are close to the Cornelia metro station and we simply called in on our way back from the city. There are many others to choose from.
reviews.title: good value rooms, good location if you can get round the public transport!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is a long way out of town, but the buses leave from directly outside. Buy the three day tourist pass for all froms of public transport in the city (11 Euros) and you won't have to worry about going into shops to buy tickets. We wouldn't have afforded Rome had we spent on a city centre hotel and meals in city restaurants. The ESH is the perfect solution.
reviews.title: ESH Bellisimo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: I was shocked to read some of the more negative reviews given the marvellous stay we had from the 20th-23rd January 2012. The hotel was bright, airy and modern. We were warmly welcomed at reception, clean, spacious room. Shower was left sparkling by the cleaners every day.We booked through Broadway travel and what a bargain! my husband and I look for a high standard and we were not disappointed. Yes there were building works going on that affected breakfast. It was machine coffee and juice but the manager assured me that by the time our teenage daughter and friend arrive for their first "grown-up" holiday alone it will all be completed. It is a short 20 minute bus ride into the heart of Rome with the bus stop literally on the doorstep, 1 euro a journey or buy a 3 day pass for 11 euros.On our last day my husband left his medication in the rooms' mini bar and when staff went to look for it it had been removed ready for next guests. The manager must have got them to search the bins or something because they found it just as our airport transfer arrived. In fact nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the manager himself was charming. (He has arranged for dinner "on the house" when our daughter arrives. Hows that for service!) You can nitpick over kettles and plugpoints but I can honestly thoroughly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but terrible staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: The cleaners do a great job of keeping your rooms in shape and the rooms are really nice to stay in. The location is quite far from central Rome and it is about a good 10-15 mins walk to the nearest metro station which is a long time if you have been out walking all day in Rome and just want to rest. However, it is close to the vatican city. You get an typical internation breakfast buffet which was terrible and the staff stare while you eat which is quite off putting.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, disappointed with the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The staff at the bar and front desk are extremely unhelpful (except for one lady whoes name was moni or something) when it came to asking for places to go and how to get their. My sister had got pick pocketed and they showed no sympathy and were extremely rude. Overall I would recommend the room but the location and the staff are complete downers.
reviews.title: Clean modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Friday when Rome experienced its heaviest snowfall for 25 years! All means of transport were thrown into chaos and it took more than 3 hours to get to the hotel in those conditions.
reviews.title: A nice hotel on the fringes of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located about 15 minutes walk from the Cornelia metro station. It is modern and one could not fault the cleanliness of the place. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. The heating broke down on Saturday evening and was repaired the following day. As it got in the room, we used blankets provided to supplement the bed covers.
reviews.title: Good all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a complimentary bottle of wine when we checked into our room. Staff were professional and helpful. The bespectacled young lady at front desk was charming and full of information. The breakfast served was adequate and of good quality with the usual cereals, fruits and cold and cooked meats.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but do not stay here if you want to be warm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, the pros outweigh the cons (no tea-making facilities - but then who would want to drink tea when good wine is inexpensive!; distance from the metro - walking is a good form of exercise!) and we have no hesitation in staying again as we would have to return to visit the sights that were closed due to the inclement weather.
reviews.title: Just a bit out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: Nice breakfast
reviews.title: A nice out of town hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hello all who stayed 16 Jan- 20 th, just been reading some of your reveiws, must say we (Kenny& Sue) enjoyed our stay, although there were issues with the restraurant, other wise we found the hotel, clean, comfortable, and friendly. The breakfast we found was good once they sorted the hot drinks machines, and of course dinner was always eventful, some great characters there with us . The staff were exellent, although out of the city it was easy to find your way around, Would we stay there again ,yes we would, I brought the attention of the co owner of the problems in the restraurant, and there was a vast improvement thereafter,
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall exellent.
reviews.title: Excellent find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were highly delighted with all aspects of this hotel, the staff, the restaurant, the room, although I could have used more electrical sockets for chargers etc, were first class, and we felt that the negative comments on TA were totally unjustified. I would recommend the ESH to anyone visiting Rome, the fact that it is away from the hubbub of the centre is a bonus as far as we were concerned, travel by bus to the tourist areas was easy and inexpensive.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay at ESH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: Highly recommended
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean modern hotel. A 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro, but if you purchase a Roma Pass, no big deal to get into the city centre. Roma Pass is also worth buying as you get free entrance to two museums, which was useful for queue jumping at the Colloseum and Palatine. Breakfast plentiful and kept us going all day. Staff very helpful and friendly. Wine and fruit provided in room on arrival and we were able to get an early check in too. There is also a well-stocked supermarket a short walk away in the direction of the Metro. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jan 25th 2012
reviews.title: Excellent room and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 night stay at ESH, can't fault the hotel or staff. Breakfast was adequate and a bonus considering price. Did not eat dinner at hotel so cannot comment. We chose to eat dinner out and took trip advisor recommendation of Alturo restaurant which we found disappointing and overpriced. The hotel staff recommended Ferro e ghiza nearby which was very good and contemporary in style. We also ate at nearby Josephs which was more traditional and excellent value (half price of Alturo). Hotel has great location with bus stop right outside and Metro stop 10 minute brisk walk. Metro easily navigated with only 2 lines to choose from. We bought a 3 day Roma pass for 30 euros which enabled us to use Metro/bus/2 museum passes (incl the colesseum but not the Vatican). The pass enabled us priority entrance at the colesseum. The city is much quieter in Jan than the Summer but there was still quite a queue which was worth 30 euros in itself. Summer is beautiful in Rome but totally overcrowded, in January it is much easier and the weather was very pleasant. In short a wonderful city and despite not throwing a coin in the Trevi Fountain we will return.
reviews.title: Smart contemporary hotel but not convenient for walking to main attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impression of hotel was immaculate modern and very contemporary with well appointed spacious rooms/bathrooms. It is advisable to request room to rear of building due to coaches parking at front and leaving early, from 6am, having parked with their engines running for upto an hour!!! We had this all three mornings we stayed!
reviews.title: 2 Star at best, claiming to be 4 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast ok but could be varied a little more. During our trip they were hosting a conference which included loud entertainment one evening. Unfortunately this took place in the roof restaurant finishing around midnight and due to the quiet location, was very audible. The following morning's breakfast staff were limited to just two people serving and this caused chaos in the restaurant meaning that tables were not cleared - no cups, glasses etc available until you asked for them. Food was not being replenished as required. There is obviously a problem when catering for residents and conference delegates at the same time. Despite its faults the staff were very friendly and helpful. Overal I would recommend this hotel as they just need to resolve a few minor issues.
reviews.title: Excellent value and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip booked through Broadway Travel; we paid the difference to fly from Bristol, no Problem with any of the booking or Broadway Travel. 20th Jan 2012 3 day city break.
reviews.title: Superb hotel but dire restaurant
